data.text: A flat piece of coarse fabric or other material used for wiping one's shoes or feet, or in various other forms as a floor covering.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A small flat piece of decorated material placed under a lamp, dish of food, or other object.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A floor pad to protect athletes, as in wrestling or gymnastics.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A densely woven or thickly tangled mass.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The solid part of a lace design.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A heavy woven net of rope or wire cable placed over a blasting site to keep debris from scattering.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To cover, protect, or decorate with mats or a mat.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To pack or interweave into a thick mass.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: High winds matted the leaves against the base of the fence.

data.text: To be packed or interwoven into a thick mass; become entangled.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A decorative border placed around a picture to serve as a frame or provide contrast between the picture and the frame.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
